parameter.caption: Enable time filters?
parameter.help: Should the declared time filters be processed? (it is very strongly suggested to keep it set to TRUE for most applications)

parameter.label: ENABLE_METEO_FILTERS
parameter.caption: Enable meteo parameters filters?

parameter.label: Add/Remove Filter

parameter.help: Select filter for parameter "${text}"
Enter meteo parameter and add a filter for it

option.caption: None
option.help: This does nothing (this is useful in an IMPORT to overwrite previous filters)

option.caption: Min Range Filter

parameter.help: If "soft", all rejected data will be replaced by either the minimum permissible value or a user-defined MIN_RESET value (if given in Adjust to).

option.help: Min range filter. Reject all values smaller than the min.

option.caption: Max Range Filter

parameter.help: If "soft", all rejected data will be replaced by either the maximum permissible or a user-defined MAX_RESET value (if given in Adjust to).

option.help: Max range filter. Reject all values greater than the max.

option.caption: Minimum and Maximum Filter

parameter.help: The keyword "soft" maybe added, in such a case all data greater than the max would be assigned the maximum permissible value and all data smaller than the min would be assigned the minimum permissible value or an optional extra set of two user provided values
Leave these fields blank to default to MIN and MAX, respectively

option.help: Minimum and maximum filter. Reject all values greater than the max or smaller than the min.

option.caption: Conditional Minimum and Maximum Filter

parameter.help: The keyword "soft" maybe added, in such a case all data greater than the max would be assigned the maximum permissible value and all data smaller than the min would be assigned the minimum permissible value or an optional extra set of two user provided values
Leave these fields blank to default to MIN and MAX, respectively

SOFT: If true, values are not filtered to nodata but to the filter limits or the reset values. RESET: Values filtered if neither MIN nor MAX are supplied are not filtered to nodata, but to this. IGNORE_MISSING: Skip over access errors if PARAMETER is an extra parameter and not present

option.help: Conditional min/max filer that only takes action if a different parameter holds true to a condition.

option.caption: Rate Filter

parameter.label: Method:
parameter.help: Which points (from the point of view of the current point) are used to compute the rate of change. For example, Left computes the rate from the last point before the current point (ie at its left); Left_Or_Right filters the current point out if either the left or the right rate of change are above MAX or below MIN.

option.help: Rate of change filter. Calculate the change rate (ie: slope) between two points, if it is above a user given value (or optionally below some value), reject the point.

option.caption: Unheated Rain Gauge Filter

parameter.help: Non-zero measurements are accepted only if they take place when the relative humidity is high enough and TA and TSS are close enough, otherwise they get reset to 0. If none of these conditions could be tested (for lack of data), then the precipitation is reset to nodata (or left unchanged if "soft" has been selected).

option.help: Filters out snow melting in an unheated rain gauge. This filter can ONLY be applied to precipitation.

option.caption: Detect grass under the sensor

parameter.help: This removes the data points that don't match snow on the ground criterias (see Tilg, A.-M., Marty C. and G. Klein, "An automatic algorithm for validating snow depth measurements of IMIS stations", Swiss Geoscience Meeting, 2015). It uses HS, TSS, TSG and RSWR to infere if there is snow or grass on the ground. TSS_meas + TSS_offset is compared to given thresholds to determine if snow can exist on the ground, so you can give a negative offset to more easily keep snow on the ground)

option.help: Grass signal removal in snow height, because the snow height sensor might not be able to distinguish between snow or vegetation/grass on the ground.

option.caption: Potential Short Wave

parameter.caption: Soft
parameter.help: If true, filtered values are set to the filter limits (coefficient * calculation) instead of nodata

option.help: Set to GROUND to use ground level global radiation when evaluating the minimum plausible radiation

parameter.label: MEAN_PERIOD
parameter.help: Average the radiation over this given period (in seconds). If your data logger aggregates measurements this can lead to troubles at the steeper parts of the potential radiation curve. For 10 minutes, the difference can be a couple of dozens W/m^2 which would be averaged and compared to the theoretical value at the end of the aggregation period. To remedy this, you can set MEAN_PERIOD.

option.help: Short wave potential radiation filter. This checks that for each point, the measured radiation is greater than the horizontal top of atmosphere potential radiation multiplied by the min_coeff coefficient and less than the global horizontal potential radiation multiplied by the max_coeff coefficient. See Moradi, I., "Quality control of global solar radiation using sunshine duration hours", 2009, Energy 34, no. 1, 1-6.

option.caption: Arithmetic Filter

parameter.label: FORMULA
parameter.help: Arithmetic expression the meteo parameter the filter runs on will be evaluated to. Example: meteo(TA) - 273.15

parameter.label: FORMULA_ELSE
parameter.help: Expression the parameter the filter runs on is evaluated to if the conditions below are not met.

Below you can enter conditions that must be met in order for the filter to take effect. If a condition is entered (this is optional), then the expression from above will only be evaluated if it is met. Otherwise, the filter does nothing.

parameter.label: CONNECTIVE

o.h: All of the following expressions must evaluate to true.
At least one of the following expressions must evaluate to true.

parameter.help: Logical connective for the conditions below. Either all (AND), or a single one (OR) of the following expressions must evaluate to true.

parameter.label: Add Condition:
parameter.help: Enter 3 parts of the condition: Expression that will be compared, comparison operator, compare "expression" against COMPARE.

parameter.label: ASSIGN
parameter.help: Change parameter to store final result in.

parameter.label: SKIP_NODATA
parameter.caption: Do not calculate with nodata values
parameter.help: Any input nodata stays untouched. Checks for nodata in COMPARE will not be called.

option.help: This filter evaluates an arithmetic expression and filters the meteo parameters to the result. You can use a number of substitutions from your data and station meta data.

option.caption: Standard deviation filter
option.help: Standard deviation filter. Values outside of mean ± 2 std_dev are rejected.

option.caption: Median Absolute Deviation

parameter.label: MIN_SIGMA
parameter.help: Prevents sigma_mad to get too small by forcing a minimum value

parameter.caption: Strict
parameter.help: Activate "strict" if the inability to define a window should invalidate the data (default: false)).

option.help: Median Absolute Deviation. Values outside of median ± 3 σ_MAD are rejected.

option.caption: Tukey 53H Filter
option.help: Tukey 53H method: A smooth time sequence is generated from the median, substracted from the original signal and compared with the standard deviation. See "Despiking Acoustic Doppler Velocimeter Data", Derek G. Goring and Vladimir, L. Nikora, Journal of Hydraulic Engineering, 128, 1, 2002. The deviation factor coeffecient is currently hard-coded as k=1.5.

option.caption: Phase space despiking

parameter.help: either use the Goring or the Mori version of the algorithm

parameter.label: Sensitivity:
parameter.help: Scaling factor applied to the universal threshold, a larger value rejects more spikes (default: 1)

parameter.label: Degree of interpolation:
parameter.help: The parameter interpol_deg sets the degree of the fit for the replacement. 1 is linear, 2 is quadratic, ..., 0 means "off" (removed spikes will be nodata and can be resampled later via [Interpolations1D]). This is useful in rare cases where the cubic fit happens to produce an unwanted peak by itself. Default value is 3 (cubic fit) as proposed in the paper by Goring.

parameter.label: Interpolation points:
parameter.help: The number of points used for the fitting (replacement) of the spikes can be set via interpol_pts. Default is 24 (as proposed in the paper by Goring).

option.help: Despiking Filter. The first and second derivatives are used to plot each point in phase space. The points are enclosed within an ellipsoid and the points lying outside are removed, the gaps being interpolated with a quadratic fit. See "Despiking Acoustic Doppler Velocimeter Data", Derek G. Goring and Vladimir L. Nikora, Journal of Hydraulic Engineering, 128, 1, 2002 as well as "Noise of Acoustic Doppler Velocimeter Data in Bubbly Flows", Mori, N., Suzuki, T. and Kakuno, S., J. Eng. Mech., 133(1):122-125, 2007

option.caption: Remove periods with low variance

parameter.label: MAX_VARIANCE
parameter.help: You can set the maximum variance that is allowed with MAX_VARIANCE. If not set, this value is 0.

option.help: Low variance filter. This filter removes time periods showing insufficient changes (based on the variance).

option.caption: Remove points with high variance
option.help: Time consistency. This compares the change between two points with 4 times the standard deviation to keep or remove each points. It is based on Zahumensky, Igor, "Guidelines on Quality Control Procedures for Data from Automatic Weather Stations, World Meteorological Organisation", 2004.

option.caption: Kalman Filter

parameter.label: State dynamics:
parameter.help: State transition matrix. For a constant state for example you can enter the unit matrix as simply 1 to put ones on the diagonal, or specify the full matrix via [1, 0, 0][0, 1, 0][0, 0, 1].
State of the system at T=0; trust in the initial state.

parameter.label: Observation covariance matrix:

option.help: Kalman filter (please have a look at the documentation!)

option.caption: DeAccumulate
option.help: Convert accumulated values back to instantaneous values (for example, accumulated solar radiation from ECMWF). This filter recomputes the instantaneous values by considering that once a value gets smaller than its preceding values, the end of the accumulation period has been reached, so the value is kept as is and the process starts over again (thus this assumes that they are no negative values).

option.help: Exponential smoothing processing, exponential moving average s_0 = x_0 s_n = alpha*x_(t-1) + (1-alpha)*s_t-1

option.caption: Weighted Moving Average Smoothing
option.help: Weighted moving average smoothing such as: WMA = (1*X1 + 2*X2 + ... + n*Xn) / sum_of_weights

option.caption: WMO Undercatch Filter

parameter.label: T_SNOW
parameter.help: Snow temperature threshold, default -2 °C

parameter.label: T_RAIN
parameter.help: Rain temperature threshold, default +2 °C

option.help: this applies a constant factor to the precipitation (the solid and mixed precipitation factor must be provided). The snow and rain temperature thresholds can optionally be provided

WMO undercatch correction. This implements the standard methods for precipitation correction as described in "WMO Solid Precipitation Measurement Intercomparison", B. Goodison, P. Louie and D. Yang, 872, 1998 as well as the overview given by "Literature Study on the Correction of Precipitation Measurements", Annette Wagner, 2009. The correction parameters for the shielded Hellmann gauge (German version) are from "Wind-induced Precipitation Undercatch of the Hellmann Gauges", Daqing Yang et al, Nordic Hydrology, 30, 1999, pp 57-80.

option.caption: Forland Undercatch Filter
option.help: Forland undercatch correction. This implements the standard methods for precipitation correction as described in "Manual for operational correction of Nordic precipitation data", E. Førland, P. Allerup, B. Dahlström, E. Elomaa, T. Jónsson, H. Madsen, P. Perälä Rissanen, H. Vedin, and F. Vejen, 1996, Tech. Rep. 24/96, Norske Meteorologiske Institutt. Some specific coefficients have been calculated by N. Wever for the Davos Weisflujoch experimental field ("wfj" gauge choice).

option.caption: Hamon Undercatch Filter
option.help: Hamon undercatch corection. This implements the standard methods for precipitation correction as described in "Computing actual precipitation", W. R. Hamon, in Distribution of precipitation in mountaineous areas, Geilo symposium 1, pp 159-174, World Meteorological Organization, Geneva, 1972.

option.caption: Distribute precipitation

parameter.label: Measurement period:
parameter.help: Measured accumulation period in seconds.

parameter.caption: SOFT enabled
parameter.help: If set to TRUE, all missing data will be replaced by zeroes, otherwise nodata will propagate.

option.help: This distributes accumulated precipitation by assuming that the precipitation has been measured on intervals greater than the sampling interval of the data file (for example, 24 hours accumulations written once per day in an hourly file, the other timesteps receiving nodata). Please be aware that the accumulation has to be written on the last timestep of the accumulation period.

option.caption: Shading

parameter.label: Horizon input file
parameter.help: Optional file containing the horizons to use to compute the shading

parameter.label: Horizon output file
parameter.help: Optional file to write the horizons used to compute the shading to

option.help: Apply shading to radiation measurements. The shading from the surrounding is either computed from the DEM (provided with the DEM plugin) or from a provided horizon file. If an output file is provided, the horizons will be written back to this output file (if at least one has been computed from the DEM).

option.caption: Reduce pressure to sea level
option.help: reduce pressure. This converts local air pressure to sea level pressure.

option.caption: Relative humidity over water correction
option.help: Relative humidity over water or ice. This corrects relative humidity over water for the full temperature range to relative humidity over ice when the air temperature is below the triple point and over water otherwise. For example useful for weather stations that report relative humidity with respect to water for the full temperature range.

option.caption: Wind reprojection

parameter.label: epsg:
parameter.help: Target EPSG code for transformation (default: COORDPARAM from the [Input] section)

option.help: Project wind direction, and/or wind speed components, from WGS84 to a PROJ4 supported coordinate system, defined by an EPSG code (requires PROJ4). It assumes the wind direction and/or the U and V wind speed components are defined in WGS84 (i.e, north/south is parallel to longitude, and east/west is parallel to latitude). After transformation to a PROJ4 supported coordinate system defined by an EPSG code, the wind direction is defined such that north/south is parallel to northing, and east/west is parallel to easting.
